item.title: COMPLAINING
item.description:
• Skill: Speaking
  • Level: Beginner
  • Goal: Speak English Fluently
  • Compiled by: Dian Budi Rahayu

COMPLAINING



You are going to practice how to complain something to other people.

Pay attention to the example below.



Situation


One morning you went to a toy story to buy a toy car which had some lights in different colors that would be shining if it is put a battery in the battery space. But when you tried to operate it at home, the lights did not shine. You tried to put another battery but it still did not work. The car seemed to be broken


After knowing the situation, you have to make a dialogue based on the situation. For the example:


Ben : Excuse me.

Mr. John : Yes boy, what can I do for you?

Ben : I was who just bought this toy car here.

Mr. John : Yes, what happen?

Ben : I just came back to home then tried to operate this toy car. But unfortunately the lights it has did not shine. I though it must be the battery I put in.

Mr .John : Are you sure? Have you tried to use another battery?

Ben : Yes, I’ve tried to change the battery but the lights did not work still. It seemed the car is broken. So how is the solution? Will the car be repaired or you give me the new one? This is the receipt sir.

Mr. John : Yes I see, sorry for the problem. Here it is, I give you the new one.

Ben : Thank you sir.

Mr. John : You’re welcome.


After making the dialogue, please practice it with your friend



IT IS TIME TO PRACTICE.





Situation 1:


Yesterday your mother went to a shoe shop. She bought a pair of shoes for you. When she arrived at home, you tried the shoes but the size was too small for you. So you could not wear the shoes. You wanted to complain and turned the shoes back without telling your mother. Fortunately the shop allows the customer to turn back the nonsense shoes had bought.

Make a dialogue contain tour complain based on the situation given!



Situation 2:


One evening, you went to a shop and you bought new T-shirt. You liked it very much but you forgot to check that T-shirt. When you arrived at home, unfortunately there was a part torn little.

Make a dialogue contain tour complain based on the situation given!



Complete this Task

item.title: DAILY ACTIVITIES
item.description:
• Skill: Speaking
  • Level: Beginner
  • Topic: Daily Activities
  • Compiled by: Hin Farah Intidara

Task 3



Here, you are going to tell about someone’s daily activities.
You can follow from the START and mention orally the activities until FINISH.





Follow-up Activities


You have understood about telling someone’s daily activities. Now, tell your friends about yours and ask theirs.

item.title: FAMILY
item.description:
• Skill: Speaking
  • Level: Beginner
  • Topic: Family
  • Compiled by: Hin Farah Intidara

Task 3



Press the "right arrow" to go to next slide and "left arrow" to go to previous slide.


Hello!
Today, we are going to talk about...

Family

The Rule
You have to answer the question orally in every slideshow.
After that, you may continue to the next slide.
Speak as good English as you can.

Ready to talk?

1
How many people are there in your family?
Who are they?

2
Do you have any brothers or sisters?
Talk about them

3
Who is the oldest in your family?
Who is the youngest?
Talk about them

4
How many grandparents have you got?
How often do you see them?

5
How many cousins do you have?
What do you do when you see them?

6
Pick one of your family member.
Describe his/her looks (=outside) and characters (=inside).

7
How do your parents earn a living? (=What are their jobs).
Talk about them.

8
Talk about the relative you like the most.
Why do you like him/her?

9
What do your parents look like?
Do you take after them? (=look like them)

10
Do you have any family living or working in other province?
Where and what do they do?

11
Are there any rules in your family?
What are they?
Do you think they are fair?

12
Does your family eat meals together?
What else do you do together?

13
What does your family do usually do when holiday?
Talk about it.

14
Do you ever hold a family reunion?
What happens there?

15
Is family important to you?
Explain why.

DONE
What a nice family!
Thank you for telling about your family ^^

See you later!



Complete This Task

item.title: GIVING DIRECTION
item.description:
• Skill: Speaking
  • Level: Beginner
  • Topic: Giving Advice
  • Compiled by: Hin Farah Intidara

Task 4



Here, you are going to give advices based on the situations given.

But before, here are the ways to give advice:





Now, let’s try!
Give your advice orally to these situations.




Follow-Up Activities:


You have understood about how to give advice.
Now, ask your friends/family whether they need your advice. Who knows you will be a good advisor.


Good Luck!

https://en.islcollective.com/resources/printables/worksheets_doc_docx/board_game_-_advice_needed/modals-phillipr-advice/762

item.title: GIVING DIRECTION
item.description:
• Skill: Speaking
  • Level: Beginner
  • Topic: Giving Direction
  • Compiled by: Hin Farah Intidara

Task 2



Here, you are going to read a map and giving direction.

But at first, pay attention to the following traffic marks.





Now, you are going to see a map. Pay attention to the map!




Mention orally the direction of how to get to:


1. Hospital
2. Bus Station
3. Italian Restaurant
4. Supermarket
5. Factory
6. Cinema



Follow-Up Activities:


You have understood about how to give direction. Now, find your own city map, and ask someone to ask you how to get to certain places in your city.


Good Luck!



Sources:

learnenglishteens.britishcouncil.org/skills/listening-skills-practice/giving-directions shutterstock.com/s/t-junction/search.html
etc.usf.edu/clipart/galleries/692-advisory-and-warning-signs
www.drivingtesttips.biz/roundabouts.html

item.title: GIVING OPINIONS
item.description:
• Skill: Speaking
  • Level: Beginner
  • Topic: Giving Opinions
  • Compiled by: Hin Farah Intidara

Task 3



Press the "right arrow" to go to next slide and "left arrow" to go to previous slide.


Hello!
Today, we are going to talk about...

Your Opinions

The Rule
You have to give your opinion whether you agree/disagree based on the statement in every slideshow orally. Don't forget to mention your reason.After that, you may continue to the next slide.
Speak as good English as you can.

Ready to talk?

1. What do you think?

If people watch too much TV.

2. What do you think?

Having a large number of holidays isn't interesting.

3. What do you think?

Eat fruits will make our stomach sick.

4. What do you think?

Bring cell phones to school is useful.

5. What do you think?

Money makes everyone happy.

6. What do you think?

If everyone in this world has a car.

7. What do you think?

Foreign people learn how to practice our traditional dance.

8. What do you think?

Music can help students learn better.

9. What do you think?

Football is boring.

10. What do you think?

Having siblings is fun.

DONE!
Nice opinions!
Thank You for sharing your thought.

See you later!




Complete This Task
